page.title: 17Fishing the Parrett Estuary.
page.content: {Mr.Sellick},who lives at Stolford, is the only man that fishes on the mud flats on the River Parrett Estuary.He has been fishing since he was 14! His father and grandfather also did it before him. He goes out every day,2 hours before low tide. He catches shrimp,crabs,eels,squid,mullet,plaice, doversole,bass,salmon and other common fish.If there are Westerly Gales the seaweed is brought up and gets caught in the nets and he does not get so many fish.He pushes a wooden sledge, which he has made,out onto the mud. He collects the nets he has set on the previous low tides and puts out empty ones for the next catch.He has a small building near his house in which he has a big freezer to keep his catch.He cooks the shrimps in a container over a wood fire.He sells them to locals,if his catch is big it's sold at Bristol.
